formElement.label: Configuration Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Wlst Script Absolute Path:
formElement.documentation: Absolute path to WLST. i.e: '/path/to/wlst.cmd' or 'wlst.sh'.

formElement.label: Application Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the application to undeploy. i.e: 'webapp'.

formElement.label: Retire Gracefully?: (DEPRECATED)
formElement.documentation: Retirement policy to gracefully retire an application only after it has completed all in-flight work. This policy is only meaningful for stop and redeploy operations and is mutually exclusive to the retire timeout policy. This parameter is DEPRECATED and will be removed in the next release.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Retirement policy to gracefully retire an application only after it has completed all in-flight work.
This policy is only meaningful for stop and redeploy operations and is mutually exclusive to the retire timeout policy. This parameter is DEPRECATED and will be removed in the next release.

formElement.label: Application Version:
formElement.documentation: Specifies a single application version to be undeployed. See Requirements and Restrictions for Production Redeployment for reference.

formElement.label: Additional options:
formElement.documentation: Additional options for undeploy API call. (See deploy function for reference).

formElement.label: Give Up on Error?:
formElement.documentation: If checked, any ambiguous situation will be treated as fatal error. Defaults to false.
